name: 教育統計學（二）
restrict: ◎必須先修過【E0U0001  教育統計學（一）】、【05UG020  統計學】其中一門 ◎課程開放上修
goals: 認識推論統計之基本概念
學習各類統計方法之意義、計算、解釋與正確用途
培養邏輯性思考與分析之學習能力
syllabus:
Course Title

Educational Statistics (II)

Instructor

Lin Hsiao-Hui

 Department/Institute

College of Education

No. of Credit

2

class time

二 3-4

class locations

NTNU Main Campus I Jheng Building 201R

Course Material

Aron, A., Aron, E. N., & Coups, E. J. (2006). _Statistics for Psychology_. Pearson Prentice Hall.

Course Description

1.  Introduction the theory, methods, and applications of statistics, including an understanding of the basic concepts of educational assessment.
2.  Understanding the relationship between statistics and teaching, tasks and functions and implementation procedures, and apply them to instructional assessment.
3.  Cultivating the ability to read quantitative empirical research reports, and make comments on statistical analysis and interpretation of results.
4.  Being able to apply statistical techniques to analyze and interpret quantitative data and information according to the purpose of quantitative research.

Course

Objectives

1.  Understanding the basic theory, concepts and application knowledge of statistics.
2.  Understanding the basic procedures and methods of statistics (including reports).
3.  Performing basic procedures and methods of statistics (SPSS...).
4.  Planning and designing procedures and methods for statistical analysis used by independent quantitative studies.

Reference

Miller, M. D., Linn, R. L., & Gronlund, N. E. (2012). Measurement and Assessment in Teaching. Hoboken: Pearson Education.

Murphy, K. R. & Davidshofer, C. O. (2005). Psychological testing: principles and applications. Upper Saddle River, N.J.: Pearson/Prentice Hall.

Teaching Strategies

1.  Lecture
2.  Participating in class discussions (20%)
3.  Demonstrating and explaining the operation of statistical analysis
4.  Workshop (80%)

學習

任務

1.  midterm exam
2.  special reports

1.  Each group has to decides a title on quantitative survey research.
2.  Each group has to develop psychological or educational test items, and find suitable subjects to test and collect responses.
3.  Each group has to analyze the collected data and report the analysis results.

Evaluation

Participating in class discussion

20%

midterm exam

40%

special reports

40%
